Forcing a User to Log Off

For a variety of reasons, it may be necessary to force one or more specific users to log off. These reasons include code violations or the need for disaster recovery efforts.

If you force a user to log off, the user’s next operation produces the following error message:

You are no longer logged on.

To log on again, the user must exit the application and restart it.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To force a user to log off:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged on to the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

    The User Manager dialog opens. By default, the All Users group is selected, so all user names are shown in the Users pane.

  4. Select the user's name.

  5. Right-click to open the context menu, and select Force Logoff. The user is immediately denied access to the Server and to all projects residing in the server configuration.

Note: You cannot force your own logoff.
